tool.name: SAGA.ta_slope_stability.5
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEM False isArrayC False isArrayD False output_data_E $output_data_E output_data_F $output_data_F output_data_G $output_data_G name SAGA.ta_slope_stability.5 DEM $DEM C $C D $D fB $fB fC $fC prefer $prefer response $response outputType_E $OutputSection_E.outputType_E transmissionMode_E $OutputSection_E.transmissionMode_E outputType_F $OutputSection_F.outputType_F transmissionMode_F $OutputSection_F.transmissionMode_F outputType_G $OutputSection_G.outputType_G transmissionMode_G $OutputSection_G.transmissionMode_G

param.name: DEM
param.label: Elevation
param.help: A Digital Elvation Model (DEM) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi

param.name: C
param.label: Dip grid (degrees)
param.help: A grid representing the dip of the structure plane (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi

param.name: D
param.label: Dip direction grid (degrees)
param.help: A grid representing the dip direction of the structure plane (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi

param.name: fB
param.label: Global structure dip (degrees)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fC
param.label: Global structure dip direction (degrees)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_E
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_F
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_G
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: <br/>This tool computes the acute angle raster between the topographic surface defined by slope and aspect rasters internally derived from input elevation raster, and a structural plane defined by diop direction- and dip grids. Optionally, the dip direction and dip of the cutting line linears between the two planes can be calculated<br/>Reference: <a href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0098300403000864">Günther, A. (2003). SLOPEMAP: programs for automated mapping of geometrical and kinematical properties of hard rock hill slopes. Computers & Geosciences, 29, 865 - 875</a>.<br/>
